meanings.definition: A mood disorder characterized by alternating periods of hypomania and mild depression.
meanings.sent1: Cyclothymia can cause someone to feel very energetic and happy at times, then very sad at other times.
meanings.sent2: Her cyclothymia makes her mood swing between extreme happiness and mild sadness.
meanings.sent3: When Bob's cyclothymia kicks in, he becomes the life of the party one day and a couch potato the next.
meanings.sent4: The rollercoaster of emotions in cyclothymia is like a never-ending dance between joy and gloom.
meanings.sent5: Living with cyclothymia is like riding waves of euphoria and melancholy throughout the year.

meanings.definition: The presence of numerous periods of hypomanic symptoms and mild depressive symptoms over a period of at least two years.
meanings.sent1: Dealing with cyclothymia means experiencing frequent shifts between high energy and low moods over a long time.
meanings.sent2: Her cyclothymia diagnosis explained why she had been feeling so up and down for the past two years.
meanings.sent3: The cyclothymia in the office was evident as some days everyone was buzzing with ideas, and other days they were all dragging their feet.
meanings.sent4: The cyclothymia of the weather mirrored the unpredictable nature of the stock market.
meanings.sent5: The cyclothymia of the city's nightlife was like a heartbeat, pulsing with excitement and then calming down.
